sen.j: 山本勝一（やまもとまさかず）1928年-、大阪府出身の観世流能楽師、1943年旧制高津中学校（現大阪府立高津高等学校）卒業。
sen.e: Masakazu YAMAMOTO (１９２８－) is a performer in the Kanze school of Japanese traditional Noh drama who graduated in 1943 from the former Kozu Middle School (present day Kozu Municipal High School, Osaka).

Masakazu YAMAMOTO (１９２８－) is a performer in the Kanze school of Japanese traditional Noh drama who graduated in 1943 from the former Kozu Middle School (present day Kozu Municipal High School, Osaka).

Masakazu YAMAMOTO (1928 -) is a performer in the Kanze school of Japanese traditional Noh drama who graduated in 1943 from the former Kozu Middle School (present day Kozu Municipal High School, Osaka).
１９４５: Graduated from the Kansai University Preparatory School
１９４５: Graduated from the Kansai University Preparatory School
1945: Graduated from the Kansai University Preparatory School
Background
Background
Summary

sen.j: 山本家は信州山本城諏訪盛重に起源を発する。
sen.e: The Yamamoto family originates with Suwa MORISHIGE and the Yamamoto-jo castle in Shinshu Province.
The Yamamoto family originates with Suwa MORISHIGE and the Yamamoto-jo castle in Shinshu Province.
The Yamamoto family originates with Suwa MORISHIGE and the Yamamoto-jo castle in Shinshu Province.

sen.j: 大正時代に二十四世観世宗家に入門し、昭和初期に山本能楽堂（大阪市中央区）を建設するなど能楽の大阪での普及に貢献した先代の山本博之の後を継いだ。
sen.e: During the Taisho period (1912-1926), the Kanze family line entered its 24th generation and then in the early Showa period (1926-1989),contributed to the diffusion of Noh drama in Osaka started with Hiroshi YAMAMOTO building the Yamamoto Noh Theatre (located in Chuo-ku, Osaka City) etc and subsequently continued.

During the Taisho period (1912-1926), the Kanze family line entered its 24th generation and then in the early Showa period (1926-1989),contributed to the diffusion of Noh drama in Osaka started with Hiroshi YAMAMOTO building the Yamamoto Noh Theatre (located in Chuo-ku, Osaka City) etc and subsequently continued.

During the Taisho period (1912-1926), Masakazu became a disciple of the 24th generation hereditary head of the Kanze family, and he succeeded Hiroyuki YAMAMOTO who contributed to the diffusion of Noh drama in Osaka such as building the Yamamoto Noh Theatre (located in Chuo-ku, Osaka City) in the early Showa period (1926-1989).
sen.cmt: 原文の解釈がおかしいので再構成しました。

sen.j: 中学時代より観世流山本職分家の当主として能の研鑽に努め、観世流の関西における重鎮となった。
sen.e: From Masakazu`s middle school days he devoted himself to the study of Noh drama as head of the Yamamoto branch family within the Kanze school, becoming the leader of the Kanze school in the Kansai area of Japan.

From Masakazu`s middle school days he devoted himself to the study of Noh drama as head of the Yamamoto branch family within the Kanze school, becoming the leader of the Kanze school in the Kansai area of Japan.

From middle school days Masakazu devoted himself to the study of Noh drama as head of the Yamamoto branch family within the Kanze school, becoming the leader of the Kanze school in the Kansai area of Japan.

sen.j: （財）山本能楽会の会長を務める。
sen.e: Masakazu is Chairman of the Yamamoto Noh Drama Association Inc.
Masakazu is Chairman of the Yamamoto Noh Drama Association Inc.
Masakazu is Chairman of the Yamamoto Noh-Theater.

sen.e: Recognized as an `important intangible cultural asset`.

sen.j: 大阪市市民文化功労者表彰
sen.e: Recognized for distinguished service to citizens culture in Osaka city.
Recognized for distinguished service to citizens culture in Osaka city.
Recognized for 'Award for Person of Cultural Merits of Osaka Citizen'.

sen.j: 1995年「姨捨」が高い評価を受け、大阪文化祭賞（金賞）
sen.e: 1995: Received excellent reviews for his production of `Obasute` (The Deserted Crone) and won the Osaka Culture Festival Award (Gold Prize).
1995: Received excellent reviews for his production of `Obasute` (The Deserted Crone) and won the Osaka Culture Festival Award (Gold Prize).
